titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 121
CWG14277

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 7

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 12th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 121. }
(Extract.)

28. 2d Lieutenant Thomas B. String, 11th Kentucky Cavalry, a paroled Prisoner of War, is hereby mustered out and honorably discharged the service of the United States, he being a supernumerary officer, with condition that he shall receive no final payments, until he has satisfied the Pay Department that he is not indebted to the Government.

On receipt of this Order at the Headquarters of the regiment, the Commanding Officer will cause the name of this officer to be taken up on the rolls and properly accounted for, and will report to this Office under what authority his name was dropped, in violation of General Orders, No. 52, May 14th, 1862, from this Office.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
String Thos B
1 Lieut
Order
honorably discharging mustering him out fo service.
Recd A. G. O. March 21/65
